results.title: BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 76-year-old man with @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ stage 3, essential @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, and receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ presented to the Emergency Department with @DISEASE_Lethargy @DISEASE_MESH:D053609 @@@lethargy@@@ and @DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@weakness@@@ that started 3 days ago, with rapid deterioration into @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@.

citations.NLM: Bailuni Neto JJ, Siqueira BL, Machado FC, Boros GAB, Akamine MAV, Cordeiro de Paula LJ, Rodrigues de Assis AC, Soares PR, Scudeler TL. BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report Am J Case Rep. 2022 Jan 21;23():e934600. PMID: 35058422
citations.BibTeX: @article{35058422, title={BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report}, author={Bailuni Neto JJ and Siqueira BL and Machado FC and Boros GAB and Akamine MAV and Cordeiro de Paula LJ and Rodrigues de Assis AC and Soares PR and Scudeler TL}, journal={Am J Case Rep}, volume={23}, pages={e934600}}

results.title: Successful treatment of severe atenolol overdose with calcium chloride.
results.text_hl: We present a case of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@ and first-degree @DISEASE_Heart_Block @DISEASE_MESH:D006327 @@@heart block@@@, in which administration of @CHEMICAL_Calcium_Chloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002122 @@@calcium chloride@@@ led to dramatic improvement after failure of conventional treatment.

citations.NLM: O'grady J, Anderson S, Pringle D. Successful treatment of severe atenolol overdose with calcium chloride. CJEM. 2001 Jul;3(3):224-7. PMID: 17610789
citations.BibTeX: @article{17610789, title={Successful treatment of severe atenolol overdose with calcium chloride.}, author={O'grady J and Anderson S and Pringle D}, journal={CJEM}, volume={3}, number={3}, pages={224-7}}

results.title: Hemodynamic adjustments in hypertensive patients developing circulatory congestion during beta-adrenergic blockade.
results.text_hl: In the course of chronic treatment with a cardioselective beta-blocking agent (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) 6 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ out of a series of 38 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@ developed signs of @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory congestion@@@.

citations.NLM: Reybrouck T, Amery A, Billiet L, Fagard R. Hemodynamic adjustments in hypertensive patients developing circulatory congestion during beta-adrenergic blockade. Cardiology. 1979;64(2):97-109. PMID: 436128
citations.BibTeX: @article{436128, title={Hemodynamic adjustments in hypertensive patients developing circulatory congestion during beta-adrenergic blockade.}, author={Reybrouck T and Amery A and Billiet L and Fagard R}, journal={Cardiology}, volume={64}, number={2}, pages={97-109}}

results.title: Improvement in Hemodynamics After Methylene Blue Administration in Drug-Induced Vasodilatory Shock: A Case Report.
results.text_hl: CASE REPORT: This is a single case report where a poisoned @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ developed @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@vasodilatory shock@@@ following ingestion of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@.

citations.NLM: Laes JR, Williams DM, Cole JB. Improvement in Hemodynamics After Methylene Blue Administration in Drug-Induced Vasodilatory Shock: A Case Report. J Med Toxicol. 2015 Dec;11(4):460-3. PMID: 26310944
citations.BibTeX: @article{26310944, title={Improvement in Hemodynamics After Methylene Blue Administration in Drug-Induced Vasodilatory Shock: A Case Report.}, author={Laes JR and Williams DM and Cole JB}, journal={J Med Toxicol}, volume={11}, number={4}, pages={460-3}}

results.title: [Effect of the long-term atenolol therapy on the structural and functional parameters of the left ventricle in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy].
results.text_hl: Six-months treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ improved the clinical status and reduced the degree of @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated_with_Left_Ventricular_Noncompaction @DISEASE_MESH:C565277 @@@LV dilatation@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory insufficiency@@@ of @DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@functional@@@ classes I and II.

citations.NLM: Sisakian AS. [Effect of the long-term atenolol therapy on the structural and functional parameters of the left ventricle in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy]. Eksp Klin Farmakol. 1997 Nov-Dec;60(6):17-20. PMID: 9460590
citations.BibTeX: @article{9460590, title={[Effect of the long-term atenolol therapy on the structural and functional parameters of the left ventricle in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy].}, author={Sisakian AS}, journal={Eksp Klin Farmakol}, volume={60}, number={6}, pages={17-20}}

results.title: Atenolol use and clinical outcomes after thrombolysis for acute myocardial infarction: the GUSTO-I experience. Global Utilization of Streptokinase and TPA (alteplase) for Occluded Coronary Arteries.
results.text_hl: Subgroups had similar rates of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@, @DISEASE_Intracranial_Hemorrhages @DISEASE_MESH:D020300 @@@intracranial hemorrhage@@@ and reinfarction, but intravenous @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ use was associated with more @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@, recurrent @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and pacemaker use than oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ use.

citations.NLM: Pfisterer M, Cox JL, Granger CB, Brener SJ, Naylor CD, Califf RM, van de Werf F, Stebbins AL, Lee KL, Topol EJ, Armstrong PW. Atenolol use and clinical outcomes after thrombolysis for acute myocardial infarction: the GUSTO-I experience. Global Utilization of Streptokinase and TPA (alteplase) for Occluded Coronary Arteries. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1998 Sep;32(3):634-40. PMID: 9741504
citations.BibTeX: @article{9741504, title={Atenolol use and clinical outcomes after thrombolysis for acute myocardial infarction: the GUSTO-I experience. Global Utilization of Streptokinase and TPA (alteplase) for Occluded Coronary Arteries.}, author={Pfisterer M and Cox JL and Granger CB and Brener SJ and Naylor CD and Califf RM and van de Werf F and Stebbins AL and Lee KL and Topol EJ and Armstrong PW}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={32}, number={3}, pages={634-40}}

results.title: Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome
results.text_hl: We report the case of an 18-year-old girl presenting with @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@ following ingestion of 85 mg of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and 850 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ with suicidal intent.

citations.NLM: Naha K, Suryanarayana J, Aziz RA, Shastry BA. Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome Indian J Crit Care Med. 2014 Jul;18(7):467-9. PMID: 25097362
citations.BibTeX: @article{25097362, title={Amlodipine poisoning revisited: Acidosis, acute kidney injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome}, author={Naha K and Suryanarayana J and Aziz RA and Shastry BA}, journal={Indian J Crit Care Med}, volume={18}, number={7}, pages={467-9}}

results.title: The effects of beta blockers on exercise capacity and on training response in elderly subjects.
results.text_hl: Treatment of 8 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ elderly subjects with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or with @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@ did not affect exercise performance, except after the development of @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory congestion@@@ in 1 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@.

citations.NLM: Fagard R, Reybrouck T, Vanhees L, Cattaert A, Vanmeenen T, Grauwels R, Amery A. The effects of beta blockers on exercise capacity and on training response in elderly subjects. Eur Heart J. 1984 Nov;5 Suppl E():117-20. PMID: 6526030
citations.BibTeX: @article{6526030, title={The effects of beta blockers on exercise capacity and on training response in elderly subjects.}, author={Fagard R and Reybrouck T and Vanhees L and Cattaert A and Vanmeenen T and Grauwels R and Amery A}, journal={Eur Heart J}, volume={5 Suppl E}, pages={117-20}}

results.title: Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning.
results.text_hl: All subjects had hypodynamic @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory shock@@@ (@DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@, @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, and @DISEASE_Acidosis @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@) that was not adequately responsive to conventional treatment.

citations.NLM: Yuan TH, Kerns WP 2nd, Tomaszewski CA, Ford MD, Kline JA. Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning. J Toxicol Clin Toxicol. 1999;37(4):463-74. PMID: 10465243
citations.BibTeX: @article{10465243, title={Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning.}, author={Yuan TH and Kerns WP 2nd and Tomaszewski CA and Ford MD and Kline JA}, journal={J Toxicol Clin Toxicol}, volume={37}, number={4}, pages={463-74}}

results.title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Nisoldipine Coat-Core vs Diltiazem Retard in Combination with a Beta-Blocker in Patients with Stable Exertional Angina Pectoris.
results.text_hl: One @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ experienced a severe @<m>DISEASE_Shock</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory shock@@@ on the combination of diltiazem retard and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Melcher A, Abelin J, Luurila O. Efficacy and Tolerability of Nisoldipine Coat-Core vs Diltiazem Retard in Combination with a Beta-Blocker in Patients with Stable Exertional Angina Pectoris. Clin Drug Investig. 1998;15(5):389-96. PMID: 18370494
citations.BibTeX: @article{18370494, title={Efficacy and Tolerability of Nisoldipine Coat-Core vs Diltiazem Retard in Combination with a Beta-Blocker in Patients with Stable Exertional Angina Pectoris.}, author={Melcher A and Abelin J and Luurila O}, journal={Clin Drug Investig}, volume={15}, number={5}, pages={389-96}}
